meanings.definition: Extremely loud or overwhelming in sound
meanings.sent1: The deafening thunder shook the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The concert was so deafening that I had to cover my ears.
meanings.sent3: The deafening sound of the alarm clock made me jump out of bed.
meanings.sent4: The deafening silence in the room was broken by a sudden clap of thunder.
meanings.sent5: The deafening roar of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.

meanings.definition: To make someone unable to hear by a loud noise
meanings.sent1: The construction work deafening the workers with its constant drilling.
meanings.sent2: The explosion deafening everyone in the vicinity.
meanings.sent3: The noisy parrot tried to deafen its owner with its constant squawking.
meanings.sent4: The loud music from the party next door deafened my ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The referee's whistle deafened the players' ears during the intense match.
